document.title: Maryland Comprehensive Health Education Framework: Pre-Kindergarten Through High School

26D62C1202034B3884C52370AEA9DAFC.description:
Encourage peers to
make positive health
choices.

61F2748D323F4ED9A9B0F751DDCE5072.description:
Make requests to
promote personal
health.

C2F8A81336EC463397AB4B55334E0C96.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family, and community health.

B0B9C1540CF1477FAB2E76C686480292.description:
Demonstrate behaviors
that avoid or reduce
health risks.

D3C7446118754254AC274646ED192DE1.description:
Demonstrate healthy
practices and behaviors
to maintain or improve
personal health.

231222D07AEA4235AA25FF9C50B5297D.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce
health risks.

5ECEDDB1FC1B43BD888770630091CE6A.description:
Identify who can help
when assistance is
needed to achieve a
personal health goal.

9CC4042EB3A64050B9FAD1FDB39D31D6.description:
Identify a short-term
personal health goal and
take action toward
achieving the goal.

EB0BCA82E2E54BE18562340E1DA3C4E2.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.

AF9471EE62C14511947F57E96FD5C358.description:
Differentiate between
situations when a
health-related decision
can be made individually
and when assistance is
needed.

63300BC061234CD181623471E5F25E6C.description:
Identify situations when
a health-related decision
is needed.

D3C7BDFF29194EAC8E955A906C963604.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.

4EDB9E6F9CCF4AEEB7FE958608BFB2AA.description:
Demonstrate ways to
tell a trusted adult if one
is threatened or
harmed.

4B8D99F58DB04655BE214A927D2532F5.description:
Demonstrate ways to
respond when in an
unwanted, threatening
or dangerous situation.

6ED822D967B846A3A008D4F8396A6068.description:
Demonstrate listening
skills to enhance health.

17191FC1D9E745DF8DA29C6D6A268582.description:
Demonstrate healthy
ways to express needs,
wants and feelings.

40865A7684254DE6B503B9AED0C646F8.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health
and avoid or reduce health risks.

A9E6516F28F945EE9E32245DDEF24D2E.description:
Identify ways to locate
school and community
health helpers.

80F55372F51842C6A1E56BFFEA7ECE6F.description:
Identify trusted adults
and professionals who
can help promote
health.

5BB413F6135249BDBFB8849165BED7E5.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to access valid information, products, and services to enhance
health.

23A8FCE08B204125A0EC96F85C197171.description:
Describe how the media
can influence health
behaviors.

D58DFE9F1F9A4302B5862AEB561D1678.description:
Identify what the school
can do to support
personal health
practices and behaviors.

C056DFB1E4724EB5964C0C3AB2E5E702.description:
Identify how the family
influences personal
health practices and
behaviors.

F6B95D41564B4D4D8D96CA7C104EFE36.description:
Students will analyze the influence of family, peers, culture, media, technology, and other factors on
health behaviors.

E77B8FE8CD1343C0A167EC8935F4B78C.description:
Describe why sleep
and rest are
important for
proper growth and
good health.

1A0C12E1C8EA4636B74432CB58C03DE5.description:
Explain how to
protect one’s skin
and other parts of
the body from the
sun.

A61498FD57BB4EAFA4DD4EF3F4AF8D13.description:
Identify food safety
strategies that can
control germs that
cause foodborne
illness.

B5541D3E78434993AE7DDB9E3D1C6F87.description:
Explain why hygiene
is important to
health.

B64E95C576C34FA882F2FC489934F9BF.description:
Describe potential
causes and
symptoms of allergic
reactions.

5D7E9A05BEE04958BB4DD10E1D539084.description:
Describe the
concept of
moderation and the
idea that “all foods
fit.”

6C44F0EFC6DD4D299673A26B715C37BB.description:
Describe how eating
breakfast helps a
person think, work,
and play.

A59A21B581A74DEEB1C99E4E97657029.description:
Describe eating
patterns that
provide energy and
help the body grow
and develop.

6008C33F2D874F62B6F581A96E15ED02.description:
Describe how
different food
groups work
together to help us
feel hungry or full.

598B4345450C4D959CD1DFC0C9E5435F.description:
Explain the
importance of
choosing nutritious
foods and beverages
from different food
groups.

6918ABE6CA1B4A579B2FECC97C76639D.description:
Explain the benefits
of trying new foods
and respecting the
food choices of
others.

C6D1EB8CB13F4B4397FE65BEA42C4877.description:
Describe the
benefits of drinking
water versus other
beverages.

DE97501C855B4FC183D4126731BAA876.description:
Explain that it is
never a person’s
fault if someone
causes them to feel
unsafe.

DACCB2D8ED8D4F71B456DD5E4D96C3B7.description:
Identify parts of the
body that are
private on self or
others.

93945F3FFAD54EDA9AD0AD554AC17B13.description:
Demonstrate age-appropriate privacy
as well as setting
and respecting
healthy boundaries
while using
technology and
face-to-face.

B4C2361B277941028E4F55CB7CBE104C.description:
Explain appropriate
boundaries when
using technology
and the internet.

B7F8DA138400457B853FEE3E22223BBF.description:
Practice telling
trusted adults about
feelings.

27E7EF97F818405F9549DC1A2F30699B.description:
Explain the
importance of
sharing all
information with
parents, guardians,
or trusted adults.

8773737B61D34F56A911B544F2C4AE59.description:
Demonstrate what
to do when asked to
keep an
uncomfortable
secret.

29F4CEF711494680A3B6C47732322493.description:
Identify appropriate
interactions with
community helpers
(e.g., nurses,
teachers, police
officers, and
crossing guards) in
roles that help
children.

DB28917B89BD4629A6897D8771DB8279.description:
Explain how familiar
people or people in
authority can help
or harm children.

D451E6160A4246218C4148236EB7155F.description:
Model ways to tell
someone when
feeling unsafe.

017C35ADED0447F0BAD3BEA0B45809B5.description:
Identify words and
actions that
appropriately
express
affection/positive
feelings toward
trusted adults and
other important
people.

476E9B4AD6DA4787ADECD9205F4ED219.description:
Describe actions
that help one to stay
safe around familiar
people.

C52E5CB01495479EB1842C4FF5F5DC1C.description:
Model actions that
help one to stay safe
around strangers.

0B3C167A9D024F508672FFD101DB343D.description:
Identify safety
procedures to
follow if in the
presence of a
firearm.

4E6B8A140B5A45A28E9D97C7793AC599.description:
Identify ways to
reduce injuries as a
pedestrian

0AC4276D475540BAA615FB85B86DDE49.description:
Identify ways to
reduce the risk of
injuries while riding
in a motor vehicle.

935D333EC5694759BC15986BBBE793BE.description:
Describe how to
safely ride a bike, a
skateboard, a
scooter, and inline
skates.

1B0464663ECD441F996AC544B7E90E91.description:
Identify ways to
reduce injuries from
firearms, falls, and
fire.

CA224023BDF34B868F878BA6299CEAE6.description:
Demonstrate ways
to treat people of all
gender identities
and expressions
with dignity and
respect.

65C5342E0EF14B0CB8AF5CA11BBE3541.description:
Demonstrate
appropriate actions
when someone says
or does something
that does not
respect your
personal
boundaries.

754AAD7AB9EF4E4C952F380A50AD25CB.description:
Describe healthy
family and peer
relationships.

FD0B7274138345A88674638A254F1E06.description:
Explain why it is
important to
respect different
kinds of families
(e.g., single-parent,
same-gender,
intergenerational,
cohabitating,
adoptive, foster).

1CF14DF9C76149719F57B2EAB745084F.description:
Identify family and
school rules about
alcohol, nicotine
use, and electronic
smoking devices.

5537CA2BC14448628F5DE412905A7D77.description:
Identify alcohol,
nicotine, and
electronic smoking
devices.

CAB6BB4CAD6C42D694D4AAA011D16694.description:
Describe the
harmful effects of
using medicine
incorrectly.

50ECD6AB41FD47C0BBFBFD40124E32CD.description:
Explain how to use
medicine correctly.

FA64B429419A44C1A3A0BAD95B9316F6.description:
Explain the
importance of
talking with trusted
adults about
emotions and
concerns.

1BEAD5F4DE1B4C9BBDA21923D0A4637E.description:
Explain why it is
hurtful to tease or
bully others and
what to do if
someone is bullied.

FA19515BBDF643ABB84DA2D18070A58D.description:
Describe healthy
and rewarding
social interactions.

75E6DDFBA78848CF9A482264B86402D1.description:
Recognize personal
strengths in the
context of different
roles or
relationships.

4015E42FC36648AE84E8CA0432DD8A78.description:
Describe how
others may be
feeling based on
verbal and
nonverbal cues and
respond in a
healthy way.

6172D0F2301B418FBBEA6111AAA93F35.description:
Describe a variety
of personal
emotions and the
ways the body
signals these
emotions.

2826B4CC667A460BA8BE9A7A75BD1EC4.description:
Demonstrate a
variety of strategies
to express and
manage emotions.

81920AA7B6724463AF01C7EEC3198732.description:
Students will comprehend concepts related to health promotion and disease prevention to enhance
health, including:
